availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel W. Shannon (Franklin County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Resident of Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as fourth sergeant from September 13, 1861, to December 16, 1862. Served in Byrne's Battery as sergeant from December 17, 1861. Captured at Jackson County, West Virginia, on July 19, 1863. Held at Camp Douglas, Cook County, Illinois.
